timeline.body: This can be easily replaced with a loop. How deep this recursion can be?
timeline.bodyText: This can be easily replaced with a loop. How deep this recursion can be?
timeline.bodyHTML: This can be easily replaced with a loop. How deep this recursion can be?
timeline.author: pbludov

replies.bodyText:
@pbludov You are right. I have replaced it with a loop.
The recursion can reasonably be up to 6-8 level deep, depending on how many nested loops, nested expressions there are.
replies.author: anhminhtran235

timeline.message: Issue #8873: RequireThis: Incorrectly triggers for record fields in compact constructor

timeline.bodyHTML:
This variable can be initialized with ast.getParent(), so the loop simplifies to

 DetailAST tempAst = ast.getParent();
 while (tempAst != null) {
   if (tempAst.getType() == TokenTypes.COMPACT_CTOR_DEF) {
   ...

also, tempAst can be renamed to parent for readability.
timeline.author: pbludov

timeline.body: @romani @pbludov should we consider creating a `javac15` CI run for input files, similar to `javac14`? https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/be3dab2a74df0abd0712df01cd93e0ad9223ee21/.ci/travis/travis.sh#L118-L130 Since the changes in this PR relate to jdk15 syntax, and we already have an open issue for jdk15 specific syntax (#8989), this might be a good idea.
timeline.bodyText:
@romani @pbludov should we consider creating a javac15 CI run for input files, similar to javac14? 
  
    
      checkstyle/.ci/travis/travis.sh
    
    
        Lines 118 to 130
      in
      be3dab2
    
    
    
    

        
          
           javac14) 
        

        
          
             files=($(grep -Rl --include='*.java' ': Compilable with Java14' \ 
        

        
          
                   src/test/resources-noncompilable || true)) 
        

        
          
             if [[  ${#files[@]} -eq 0 ]]; then 
        

        
          
               echo "No Java14 files to process" 
        

        
          
             else 
        

        
          
                 mkdir -p target 
        

        
          
                 for file in "${files[@]}" 
        

        
          
                 do 
        

        
          
                   javac --release 14 --enable-preview -d target "${file}" 
        

        
          
                 done 
        

        
          
             fi 
        

        
          
             ;; 
        
    
  

 Since the changes in this PR relate to jdk15 syntax, and we already have an open issue for jdk15 specific syntax (#8989), this might be a good idea.
timeline.bodyHTML:
@romani @pbludov should we consider creating a javac15 CI run for input files, similar to javac14?

checkstyle/.ci/travis/travis.sh

Lines 118 to 130 in be3dab2

javac14)
files=($(grep -Rl --include='*.java' ': Compilable with Java14' \
src/test/resources-noncompilable || true))
if [[ ${#files[@]} -eq 0 ]]; then
echo "No Java14 files to process"
else
mkdir -p target
for file in "${files[@]}"
do
javac --release 14 --enable-preview -d target "${file}"
done
fi
;;
Since the changes in this PR relate to jdk15 syntax, and we already have an open issue for jdk15 specific syntax (#8989), this might be a good idea.
timeline.author: nmancus1

replies.bodyText: We we need this execution in CI
replies.author: romani
